javadoc: Interface for display fields used by the FieldPanel

methods.javadoc: Returns the current width of this field.
methods.name: getWidth
methods.comment: Returns the current width of this field.

methods.javadoc:
The minimum required width to paint the contents of this field
@return the minimum required width to paint the contents of this field
methods.name: getPreferredWidth
methods.comment: The minimum required width to paint the contents of this field

return.comment: the minimum required width to paint the contents of this field

methods.javadoc: Returns the height of this field when populated with the given data.
methods.name: getHeight
methods.comment: Returns the height of this field when populated with the given data.

methods.javadoc: Returns the height above the baseLine.
methods.name: getHeightAbove
methods.comment: Returns the height above the baseLine.

methods.javadoc: Returns the height below the baseLine.
methods.name: getHeightBelow
methods.comment: Returns the height below the baseLine.

methods.javadoc: Returns the horizontal position of this field.
methods.name: getStartX
methods.comment: Returns the horizontal position of this field.

methods.name: paint
methods.comment: Paints this field.

params.name: colorManager
params.comment: contains background color information for the field.

params.name: cursorLoc
params.comment:
the row,column cursor location within the field or null if the field does
 not contain the cursor

methods.name: contains
methods.comment: Returns true if the given point is in this field.

params.name: x
params.comment: the horizontal coordinate of the point.

params.name: y
params.comment: the relatve y position in this layout

methods.javadoc: Returns the number of rows in this field
methods.name: getNumRows
methods.comment: Returns the number of rows in this field

methods.javadoc:
Returns the number of columns in the given row.
@param row the row from which to get the number of columns.
methods.name: getNumCols
methods.comment: Returns the number of columns in the given row.

params.name: row
params.comment: the row from which to get the number of columns.

methods.name: getX
methods.comment: Returns the x coordinate for the given cursor position.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the y coordinate for the given row.
@param row the text row of interest.
methods.name: getY
methods.comment: Returns the y coordinate for the given row.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the row containing the given y coordinate.
@param y vertical pixel coordinate relative to the top of the screen.
methods.name: getRow
methods.comment: Returns the row containing the given y coordinate.

params.name: y
params.comment: vertical pixel coordinate relative to the top of the screen.

methods.name: getCol
methods.comment:
Returns the cursor column position for the given x coordinate on the given
 row.

params.name: row
params.comment: the text row to find the column on.

params.name: x
params.comment: the horizontal pixel coordinate for which to find the character position.

methods.name: isValid
methods.comment:
Returns true if the given row and column represent a valid location for
 this field with the given data;

methods.name: getCursorBounds
methods.comment: Returns a bounding rectangle for the cursor at the given position.

methods.name: getScrollableUnitIncrement
methods.comment: Returns the amount to scroll to the next or previous line

params.name: topOfScreen
params.comment: - the current y pos of the top of the screen.

params.name: direction
params.comment: - the direction of the scroll (1 down, -1 up)

params.name: max
params.comment:
- the maximum amount to scroll for the entire row - will
 be positive for down, and negative for up)

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this field is "primary" (the most important)
 field;  used to determine the "primary" line in the layout.
methods.name: isPrimary
methods.comment:
Returns true if this field is "primary" (the most important)
 field;  used to determine the "primary" line in the layout.

methods.name: rowHeightChanged
methods.comment: notifies field that the rowHeight changed

methods.javadoc: Returns a string containing all the text in the field.
methods.name: getText
methods.comment: Returns a string containing all the text in the field.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a string containing all the text in the field with extra linefeeds
@return
methods.name: getTextWithLineSeparators
methods.comment: Returns a string containing all the text in the field with extra linefeeds

methods.name: textOffsetToScreenLocation
methods.comment: Returns the row, column position  for an offset into the string returned by getText().

params.name: textOffset
params.comment: the offset into the entire text string for this field.

return.comment:
a RowColLocation that contains the row,column location in the field for a position in
 the overall field text.

methods.name: screenLocationToTextOffset
methods.comment: Returns the text offset in the overall field text string for the given row and column.

name: Field
comment: Interface for display fields used by the FieldPanel
